name: Romanesco
description: Romanesco is an engineering toolkit that combines the atomic design philosophy with MODX templating.
author: Hugo Peek

tvs.caption: Person
tvs.name: person_id
tvs.description: Connect a person to this item. This list is populated with all the persons that are listed on your Team page.

tvs.caption: Organization
tvs.name: organization_id
tvs.description: Connect the related organization(s). If this list is empty, you need to create an Organizations container first and register its ID under System Settings.

tvs.caption: Contributors
tvs.name: contributors_id
tvs.description: Team members that worked on this item. You can only select persons listed on your Team page, so if you want to add external contributors: add them to the team page first (can be unpublished).

tvs.caption: MODX user
tvs.name: user_id
tvs.description: Connect a MODX user to this item. Only active users will be shown.
tvs.inputOptionValues: @SELECT '' AS username, '' AS id UNION ALL ( SELECT username, id FROM `modx_users` WHERE `active` = 1 ORDER BY username )

tvs.caption: Email address recipient
tvs.name: fb_email_to
tvs.description: Submitted forms will be sent to this address. If you leave this field empty, no emails will be sent. This may be what you want when using a custom hook for processing the form.

tvs.caption: Email CC address
tvs.name: fb_email_cc
tvs.description: Optional.

tvs.caption: Email BCC address
tvs.name: fb_email_bcc
tvs.description: Optional.

tvs.caption: Email FROM address
tvs.name: fb_email_from
tvs.description: Optional. Defaults to emailsender system setting.

tvs.caption: Email FROM name
tvs.name: fb_email_from_name
tvs.description: Optional. Defaults to site_name system setting.

tvs.caption: Submit button text
tvs.name: fb_submit_button
tvs.description: Defaults to Send.

tvs.caption: Save form data
tvs.name: fb_save_form
tvs.description: Save submitted data in the database. You can view this data under Top menu > Extras > FormIt.

tvs.caption: Redirect page
tvs.name: fb_redirect_id
tvs.description: Enter the ID of the page, or drag the page from the menu tree to this input field.

tvs.caption: Layout type
tvs.name: fb_form_layout
tvs.description: DEPRECATED. This setting has moved to the CB field that loads the form.

tvs.caption: Custom pre-hook(s)
tvs.name: fb_prehooks
tvs.description: A snippet name (or comma separated list of snippet names), containing the hook(s). These hooks are executed before the form is initialised.

tvs.caption: Custom hook(s)
tvs.name: fb_hooks
tvs.description: A snippet name (or comma separated list of snippet names), containing the hook(s). These hooks are executed after the form is submitted, but before any emails are sent.

tvs.caption: Dynamic recipient address
tvs.name: fb_email_to_dynamic
tvs.description: Place any snippet / FastField call here that outputs a single email address. WARNING: populating this field will override the default recipient address, so test thoroughly!

tvs.caption: Dynamic redirect page
tvs.name: fb_redirect_dynamic
tvs.description: Place any element here that is able to decide where to redirect the user after form submission. If the result is empty, it falls back on the ID provided under general settings.

tvs.caption: Store submitted data
tvs.name: fb_store_data
tvs.description: Store data in a session before redirecting the user to a confirmation / thank you page, or to another form (as part of a multi-page form). Use FormItRetriever to access the data again.

tvs.caption: Store time
tvs.name: fb_store_time
tvs.description: If 'store data' is switched on, this specifies the number of seconds to store the submitted form data. Defaults to five minutes.

tvs.caption: Email template
tvs.name: fb_email_template
tvs.description: Name of the chunk containing your own customized (HTML) email template. Make sure there is a [[+content]] placeholder in there for listing the fields.

tvs.caption: Email template row prefix
tvs.name: fb_email_tpl_prefix
tvs.description: Prefix used by the chunks containing the HTML for the template rows. After this prefix follows an ID (i.e. fbEmailRow_28), connecting that chunk to the correct ContentBlocks field.

tvs.caption: Global background images
tvs.name: global_background_img
tvs.description: DEPRECATED - DO NOT USE ANYMORE! Backgrounds in this grid still work, but use the new resource-based backgrounds instead to ensure proper functionality in the future.

tvs.caption: Availability
tvs.name: background_availability
tvs.description: Where would you like to use this background?
tvs.inputOptionValues: In page headers==header||In ContentBlocks layouts==content||In footer CTAs==footer-cta||In page footers==footer

tvs.caption: Toolbar visibility
tvs.name: toolbar_visibility
tvs.description: Do you want to display a toolbar on this page? The default toolbar contains breadcrumbs and search functionality. This setting is inherited on every child page.

tvs.caption: Automatic anchors
tvs.name: auto_anchors
tvs.description: Give all headings on this page (H1-H6) an ID (if they don't have one already). This allows you (or the ToC menu) to link directly to that heading. This setting is inherited on child pages.

tvs.caption: Neighbors menu
tvs.name: neighbors_visibility
tvs.description: Do you want to display a set of buttons below the content that link to the previous and next article? This setting is inherited on child pages.

tvs.caption: Image (Landscape)
tvs.name: overview_img_landscape
tvs.description: This is the default overview image, in a regular 4:3 aspect ratio.

tvs.caption: Image (Portrait)
tvs.name: overview_img_portrait
tvs.description: This is a standing image in 3:4 aspect ratio, best suited for floating left or right of content, or for display on mobile devices.

tvs.caption: Image (Square)
tvs.name: overview_img_square
tvs.description: This is an image in 1:1 aspect ratio, for use in cards, avatars or circular images.

tvs.caption: Image (Wide)
tvs.name: overview_img_wide
tvs.description: This is an image with widescreen proportions, in 16:9 aspect ratio.

tvs.caption: Image (Panorama)
tvs.name: overview_img_pano
tvs.description: This is an image with 21:9 aspect ratio, for use in headers or layout backgrounds.

tvs.caption: Image (Free)
tvs.name: overview_img_free
tvs.description: This image doesn't have a fixed aspect ratio or any minimum dimensions. Use it as you see fit. Cropping is optional. NB! Be aware that images will probably have different sizes in overviews!

tvs.caption: Icon (Font)
tvs.name: overview_icon_font
tvs.description: Select an icon of the icon font that's being used in this project. Check the style guide for available classes, or use the autocomplete search as you type.

tvs.caption: Icon (SVG)
tvs.name: overview_icon_svg
tvs.description: This can be pretty much anything, but please make sure the SVG has a square aspect ratio.

tvs.caption: Icon credit (SVG)
tvs.name: overview_icon_svg_credit
tvs.description: Mention the designer of this icon here, so they are credited appropriately on the site. You need to do this if you're using icons published under a CC license, for example from Noun Project.

tvs.caption: Link / button text
tvs.name: overview_link_text
tvs.description: When filled in, this value will override the button text defined in the Overview ContentBlock. Keep in mind that if no button text is set in Overview CB, no button will be shown!

tvs.caption: Image priority
tvs.name: overview_img_priority
tvs.description: With this setting, you can indicate which image type you prefer if the system has a choice.

tvs.caption: Critical CSS URI
tvs.name: critical_css_uri
tvs.description: AUTOGENERATED! This path is used when server pushing the critical CSS. By default a unique file is generated for each page, but templates can also share a single CSS file (see Configuration).

tvs.caption: Behaviour
tvs.name: slider_behaviour
tvs.inputOptionValues: Infinite loop==loop||Show previous / next arrows==arrows||Keyboard control==keyboard||Free scrolling==free||Autoplay==autoplay

tvs.caption: Twitter account
tvs.name: social_twitter
tvs.description: Only fill in the account name (the part after https://twitter.com/). This way, this setting can be used by other Twitter functionality throughout the site.

tvs.caption: LinkedIn profile
tvs.name: social_linkedin
tvs.description: Please fill in the complete URL (including http(s)://).

tvs.caption: Facebook page
tvs.name: social_facebook
tvs.description: Please fill in the complete URL (including http(s)://).

tvs.caption: Instagram profile
tvs.name: social_instagram
tvs.description: Only fill in the account name (the part after https://instagram.com/).

tvs.caption: Pinterest board
tvs.name: social_pinterest
tvs.description: Please fill in the complete URL (including http(s)://).

tvs.caption: Youtube channel
tvs.name: social_youtube
tvs.description: Please fill in the complete URL (including http(s)://).

tvs.caption: WhatsApp number
tvs.name: social_whatsapp
tvs.description: A mobile phone number connected to an active WhatsApp account. If entered, visitors can start a chat directly from the website. Needs to be formatted as number, without any leading zeros.

tvs.caption: WhatsApp message
tvs.name: social_whatsapp_text
tvs.description: Predefined text for the message that the visitor can send. You can use placeholders here to include some information about the referring page.

tvs.caption: Github account
tvs.name: social_github
tvs.description: Only fill in the account name (the part after https://github.com/).

tvs.caption: Availability
tvs.name: cta_availability
tvs.description: Where would you like to be able to place this CTA?
tvs.inputOptionValues: In page header==header||In sidebar (on detail pages)==sidebar||In the content (through CB)==content||Below the content==footer

tvs.caption: Footer visibility
tvs.name: footer_visibility
tvs.description: If you turn this off, the closing footer section will not be displayed. Inherited by default, but you can change this with the Inheritance setting below.

tvs.caption: Footer type
tvs.name: footer_type
tvs.description: Choose which content to display inside the footer. You can add different footers under Global Content > Footers. A default footer can be defined under Configuration, or as context setting.

tvs.caption: Background
tvs.name: footer_background
tvs.description: Select a background for this footer. You can define these backgrounds under Global Content > Backgrounds. Will also be inherited by default.

tvs.caption: Call to action (CTA)
tvs.name: footer_cta
tvs.description: This CTA will be displayed above the footer itself. It will have a different background than the rest of the footer, which you can select below. Inherited by default.

tvs.caption: CTA background
tvs.name: footer_cta_background
tvs.description: Select a background for the CTA. To make it stand out, select a background that contrasts nicely with the footer background. Also inherited by default.

tvs.caption: Inheritance
tvs.name: footer_inheritance
tvs.description: Select which elements to display on child pages of this resource too. NB: Turning inheritance OFF for an element returns it to its default value, but that is not reflected in the manager!
tvs.inputOptionValues: Inherit visibility==inherit_visibility||Inherit type==inherit_type||Inherit background==inherit_background||Inherit CTA==inherit_cta||Inherit CTA background==inherit_cta_background

tvs.caption: Header visibility
tvs.name: header_visibility
tvs.description: If you turn this off, the page starts with the content area but the navigation bar will still be visible. Inherited by default, but you can change this with the Inheritance setting below.

tvs.caption: Main title
tvs.name: header_title
tvs.description: Title below the navigation bar. The text will automatically be inherited on child pages. You can override this behaviour by entering a new title or by deleting the inherited value.

tvs.caption: Subtitle
tvs.name: header_subtitle
tvs.description: This will be displayed under the main title. Will also be inherited on child pages by default.

tvs.caption: Background
tvs.name: header_background
tvs.description: Select a background for this header. You can define these backgrounds under Content > Global Content > Backgrounds. Will also be inherited by default.

tvs.caption: Background image
tvs.name: header_background_img
tvs.description: Use an Overview image as background. This overrides the regular Background setting above and will NOT be inherited. If you want to repeat an image on child pages, add it as Global Background.
tvs.inputOptionValues: Use the Panorama image==background_img_pano||Use the Wide image==background_img_wide

tvs.caption: Call to action (CTA)
tvs.name: header_cta
tvs.description: Select a CTA for display in header. CTAs are located in Global Content. If a CTA is selected, all Title values will be ignored but Background settings still apply. Not inherited by default.

tvs.caption: Inheritance
tvs.name: header_inheritance
tvs.description: Select which elements to display on child pages of this resource too. NB: Turning inheritance OFF for an element returns it to its default value, but that is not reflected in the manager!

tvs.caption: Content purpose
tvs.name: content_purpose
tvs.description: Select the primary function(s) of this content. You can focus on just 1 topic, or create a chain of topics to use as blueprint for your storyline.

tvs.caption: Priority
tvs.name: content_priority
tvs.description: Zoom out a little and ask yourself: do we really need this page? And do we need it now? If it turns out to be neither urgent nor important, consider deleting it again.

tvs.caption: Brief
tvs.name: content_brief
tvs.description: Try to turn the content purpose into a short summary. What are the main take-aways? Why are they important? And why should people listen to you? Add links to examples if you want.

tvs.caption: Outline
tvs.name: content_outline
tvs.description: Give an overview of the main page structure. Like a table of contents, but feel free to add ideas in between.

tvs.caption: Result
tvs.name: content_result
tvs.description: Describe the desired effect of this page. How did it help the visitor? And what good will that do for you?

tvs.caption: Follow-up
tvs.name: content_cta
tvs.description: What kind of action do you want the visitor to take after viewing this content? View related content, get in touch, subscribe to your newsletter, buy your product, donate to your cause...

tvs.caption: Tone of voice
tvs.name: content_tone
tvs.description: Decide what writing style to adopt for this page. Formal, fun, pragmatic, provocative...

tvs.caption: Re-purpose (Source)
tvs.name: content_repurpose_src
tvs.description: On which existing sources will this content be based? If the source is already pointing to this page as destination, it will show up automatically.

tvs.caption: Re-purpose (Destination)
tvs.name: content_repurpose_dest
tvs.description: Can you think of ways to reuse this content in other places or scenarios? If the destination doesn't exist yet, just enter Title and Description as an idea.

tvs.caption: Progress indicator
tvs.name: status_progress
tvs.description: What is the current development stage of this page?

tvs.caption: Health indicator
tvs.name: status_health
tvs.description: What is the current condition of this page?

tvs.caption: Improvements
tvs.name: status_improvements
tvs.description: How can we make this page better? This is aimed at the content editors team. If you have technical issues, please enter those in 'Help!' below.

tvs.caption: Help!
tvs.name: status_issues
tvs.description: What kind of problem(s) are you experiencing? This is aimed at the developers. Please create separate items if you have more than 1 issue and include any relevant info (like error messages).

tvs.caption: Content owner
tvs.name: content_owner
tvs.description: Who is responsible for editing and maintaining this page?

tvs.caption: Project timeline
tvs.name: project_hub_timeline
tvs.description: Keep track of the project's progress and see what's coming up next. You can also link to related project files and resources from here, so you can find them back more easily.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_toggle
tvs.description: IMPORTANT! For the autoresponder to know which email address to use, the Input (Email) field needs to be present in the form.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder FROM address
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_from
tvs.description: Optional. This is the address where the messages appear to be sent from. Can be a non-existing address, like mail@yourdomain.com. Defaults to emailsender system setting.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder FROM name
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_from_name
tvs.description: Optional. This is the name that will (probably) be visible in the recipients' inbox. Defaults to site_name system setting.

tvs.caption: Autoresponder REPLY TO address
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_reply_to
tvs.description: Optional. This address will be used when recipient replies to this message directly. Defaults to respectively the client_email and emailsender system setting.

tvs.caption: Autoresponse message
tvs.name: fb_autoresponder_message
tvs.description: The content of the email that will be sent. You can use placeholders here from the form fields with the following syntax: [[+fb123-field-name]]. So with ID prefix and hyphenated field name.

tvs.caption: Activation
tvs.name: fb_activation_toggle
tvs.description: Whether or not new users need to activate their account via email. IMPORTANT! For the activation process to know which address to use, the Input (Email) field needs to be present in the form.

tvs.caption: Activation page
tvs.name: fb_activation_resource_id
tvs.description: Page containing the ConfirmRegister snippet for email activation. Enter page ID or drag the page from the menu tree to this input field. Defaults to the activation_resource_id system setting.

tvs.caption: Activation TTL
tvs.name: fb_activation_ttl
tvs.description: Number of minutes until the activation email expires. Defaults to 3 hours.

tvs.caption: Activation email
tvs.name: fb_activation_email
tvs.description: The content of the activation email. Make sure it contains the [[+confirmUrl]] placeholder for the confirmation link!

tvs.caption: Username field
tvs.name: fb_username_field
tvs.description: Name of the form field that will receive the username. You can use the label name of the CB field here, or the input name in the HTML. Tip: consider using the email address here..

tvs.caption: Fullname field
tvs.name: fb_fullname_field
tvs.description: Name of the form field that will receive the full name of the user. Handy when using email address as username. You can use the label name of the CB field here, or the input name in the HTML.

tvs.caption: Password field
tvs.name: fb_password_field
tvs.description: Name of the form field that will receive a password. If empty, a password will be generated instead. You can use the label name of the CB field here, or the input name in the HTML.

tvs.caption: User groups
tvs.name: fb_usergroups
tvs.description: Optional. A comma-separated list of user group names or IDs to add the newly-registered user to.

tvs.caption: User groups field
tvs.name: fb_usergroups_field
tvs.description: Optional. The name of the form field that decides which user groups the new user will belong to. You can use the label name of the ContentBlock field here, or the name in the HTML.

tvs.caption: Extended user fields
tvs.name: fb_extended_toggle
tvs.description: If switched on, any extra fields in the form are added to the extended field in the user profile.

tvs.caption: Author
tvs.name: author_id
tvs.description: Select the author of this article. He or she must be a MODX user. This value is inherited on child pages.
tvs.inputOptionValues: @SELECT '' AS username, '' AS id UNION ALL ( SELECT username, id FROM `modx_users` ORDER BY username )

tvs.caption: Comments
tvs.name: comments_toggle
tvs.description: Enable or disable comments. This value is inherited on child pages.

tvs.caption: Rating value
tvs.name: rating_value
tvs.description: How did the user value this product or service?

tvs.caption: Organization logo (SVG)
tvs.name: organization_logo_svg
tvs.description: You'll likely get the best (sharpest) results when uploading an SVG. Try to keep the aspect ratio around 16:9 for best results.

tvs.caption: Organization logo (Image)
tvs.name: organization_logo_img
tvs.description: If you can't supply an SVG, don't worry. You can upload an image here instead. The minimum width of their logo is 600px, but to keep your website pretty, aim for at least 900px.

tvs.caption: Organization sector
tvs.name: organization_sector
tvs.description: What type of organization is this?

tvs.caption: Organization industry
tvs.name: organization_industry
tvs.description: In what field is this organization active?

tvs.caption: Organization size
tvs.name: organization_size
tvs.description: How many employees does this organization have?

tvs.caption: Organization website
tvs.name: organization_url
tvs.description: Please fill in the complete URL (including http(s)://).

tvs.caption: Profile picture
tvs.name: person_image
tvs.description: A headshot of this person.

tvs.caption: Informal picture
tvs.name: person_image_loose
tvs.description: A headshot of the same person, but with a loose, personal twist to it. A big smile, or funny expression... This can be used in areas and situations where a little playfulness is allowed.

tvs.caption: Personal website or blog
tvs.name: person_url
tvs.description: Please fill in the complete URL (including http(s)://).

chunks.name: fbGetFormID
chunks.description: Run the cbGetFieldContent snippet to find out which form is selected on a specific resource.

chunks.name: fbFormID
chunks.description: Return raw value of form_id placeholder from a CB form. Used as tpl by cbGetFieldContent in fbGetFormID.

chunks.name: fbFileUploadProperties
chunks.description: These AjaxUpload settings need to be included in the FormIt call if a multiple file upload field is being used.

chunks.name: fbMathQuestionProperties
chunks.description: These properties are added to the FormIt call if a Math Question CB is present in the form.

chunks.name: fbSelectOptionRow
chunks.description: The default row template for checkbox and radio options.

chunks.name: fbSelectOptionRowResource
chunks.description: A row template for options that link to a resource. These options are almost always generated dynamically, instead of being added through the form builder by the editor.

chunks.name: fbSelectOptionRowTag
chunks.description: A row template for options that let you select a tag. Initially designed to work with the Tagger extra, but should work with any tag system that outputs [[+tag]] and [[+alias]] placeholders.

chunks.name: fbSelectOptionRowInputOption
chunks.description: A row template for using the input options found under Manage > Tool shed.

chunks.name: fbSelectDropdownRow
chunks.description: The default row template for dropdown select options.

chunks.name: fbSelectDropdownRowInputOption
chunks.description: A row template for using the input options found under Manage > Tool shed.

chunks.name: fbInputFileSingle
chunks.description: A basic input field for uploading a single file.

chunks.name: fbInputFileMultiple
chunks.description: Use this file input field if you want users to upload more than 1 file. The AjaxUpload extra takes care of frontend functionality and backend processing. Just make sure it's installed!

chunks.name: globalBackgroundImgCSS
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: globalBackgroundImgOverviewCSS
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: globalBackgroundImgPersonCSS
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: globalBackgroundImgTVOptions
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: globalBackgroundImgTVOptionsRow
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: configSettingsRowTR
chunks.description: Table row for configuration settings table.

chunks.name: imgResponsiveRowSrcset
chunks.description: A row template for the responsiveImgSrcset snippet, containing srcset properties for use inside an tag.

chunks.name: imgResponsiveScale
chunks.description: A switch statement that selects the right viewport width for the img sizes attribute, based on the layout and column type of the container.

chunks.name: imgOpenGraphRow
chunks.description: Row template for ImagePlus, containing properties for use in Open Graph metadata.

chunks.name: mapLoadAssets
chunks.description: Load the necessary CSS and JS assets for displaying a Leaflet map. This is added to the HEAD of the page (if load_assets_map is set to 1), so maps can be initialized from content area.

chunks.name: tvSelectCTA
chunks.description: Get available CTAs and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectGlobalBackground
chunks.description: Get available backgrounds and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectFooter
chunks.description: Get available footers and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectTeam
chunks.description: Get available team members and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectClient
chunks.description: Get available clients and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectTestimonial
chunks.description: Get available testimonials and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectPortfolio
chunks.description: Get available projects and turn them into input options for use in a selection TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectInputOption
chunks.description: Generate a list of input options, which are globally defined in a MIGXdb grid. You can narrow down the selection by appending a property set with a key name inside (eg: @ContentPurpose).

chunks.name: tvSelectFibonacci
chunks.description: Pick a number from the Fibonacci sequence. Useful for example when implementing an Agile / Scrum kind of point system.

chunks.name: tvSelectCountry
chunks.description: Generate a list of countries to choose from. It can display prioritized countries in a separate group at the top of the list.

chunks.name: commentWrapper
chunks.description: DEPRECATED. Part of Tickets commenting extra.

chunks.name: commentRowBasic
chunks.description: DEPRECATED. Part of Tickets commenting extra.

chunks.name: commentRowGuest
chunks.description: DEPRECATED. Part of Tickets commenting extra.

chunks.name: commentForm
chunks.description: DEPRECATED. Part of Tickets commenting extra.

chunks.name: fbPrepareSteps
chunks.description: Prepare the necessary placeholders for each step of a multi-page form. These placeholders will be forwarded to fbForm.

chunks.name: fbSubmitButtons
chunks.description: Previous and next buttons for multi-page forms.

chunks.name: patternCategoryParent
chunks.description: Display all patterns inside a given category. The first level of nested categories is also included.

chunks.name: patternCategoryRow
chunks.description: Row template for each pattern inside the parent category. Contains basic information, source code and a list of connected patterns. Status and preview code can be included via properties.

chunks.name: patternCategoryBosonParent
chunks.description: Display all ContentBlocks elements inside a given category.

chunks.name: patternCategoryBosonRow
chunks.description: Row template for each CB element. Displays basic information and included patterns. Status is retrieved from the description and a preview can't be included in this automated representation.

chunks.name: configSettingsRow
chunks.description: Display a group of settings, as defined in the Configurations extra.

chunks.name: heroTitles
chunks.description: A basic pattern for displaying a large page header + subtitle. Because the hero unit is mainly there for presentation purposes, the titles contain no specific HTML hierarchy (like H1/H2).

chunks.name: heroVertical
chunks.description: This hero unit is adapted for use in vertical scenarios, meaning there are no grid classes present. The content is stacked as link items instead.

chunks.name: galleryRowImage
chunks.description: Basic image pattern, for use in gallery or slider. It can contain a lightbox link, which opens an enlargement of the image in a full-screen overlay window.

chunks.name: galleryRowImageCaption
chunks.description: This pattern adds a caption to the image. You can choose to either show the caption in the lightbox enlargement only, or also as a subtitle in the image grid (or slide).

chunks.name: galleryRowImageLightbox
chunks.description: This pattern evaluates if you should be able to open the image in a lightbox. If so, the required classes and properties are added to the default image.

chunks.name: flexibleRowInnerWrapper
chunks.description: The content inside a flexible Accordion or Tab CB is entered as a nested layout, meaning it's wrapped in columns. To properly display these columns in a grid, an additional wrapper is needed.

chunks.name: cardsRowBasic
chunks.description: A template for the Cards CB repeater. It uses the common pattern of an image, header, subtitle and link button.

chunks.name: cardsRowBasicLink
chunks.description: Similar to cardsRowBasic, but lets the parent decide if the card should be a link or not. In other words: it contains NO links itself. Can be (ab)used to create cards without any link at all.

chunks.name: cardsRowInnerWrapper
chunks.description: The correct card template is selected inside this wrapper. This is to avoid duplicate HTML and to keep the CB field flexible, logical and easy to use.

chunks.name: cardsRowFlexible
chunks.description: Template for Cards (Flexible) repeater. Instead of a predefined template based on the available input fields, the editor can use a nested layout to add any CB field as content for the card.

chunks.name: hero
chunks.description: The default hero unit, for use in the header of each page. This pattern evaluates a few options for its contents, appearance and inheritance, giving the editor some control over the output.

chunks.name: sliderOuter
chunks.description: DEPRECATED. Slider now uses Swiper.js and this chunk doesn't seem to be used anywhere..

chunks.name: cbGalleryDisplayType
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: cbGalleryColumnType
chunks.description: Defines the class names for individual gallery items. In ContentBlocks, this is presented to the user as Caption type because this setting mostly affects how captions are being displayed

chunks.name: cbFormLabelPosition
chunks.description: If label position is explicitly defined in the form resource CB input, then that setting is ALWAYS applied. If set to 'inherit', then the setting from the main Form CB field is respected.

chunks.name: cbGlobalBackgroundRowImg
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: tvSelectInputOptionRow
chunks.description: Basic row template for rendering input options inside the TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectInputOptionRowDesc
chunks.description: Row template with description below the title, for rendering input options inside a listbox-multiple TV.

chunks.name: tvSelectCountryOptGroup
chunks.description: Display prioritized countries in a separate group at the top of the dropdown.

chunks.name: tvSelectCountryRow
chunks.description: Basic row template to display country names inside the dropdown.

chunks.name: fbEmailRow
chunks.description: Default template for displaying the submitted value of a form field in an email message.

chunks.name: fbEmailRow_settings
chunks.description: DEPRECATED.

chunks.name: fbEmailRow_xx
chunks.description: Example row, to be copied for each available ContentBlocks form field. The xx should be replaced with the ID of the CB field. Some fields require a different format (see below)

chunks.name: fbEmailRowTerms
chunks.description: Specific email row for Terms and Conditions checkbox. It is currently empty, as the form cannot be submitted without agreeing to the terms.

chunks.name: fbEmailRowEmail
chunks.description: Specific email row for Email field.

chunks.name: fbEmailRowDateRange
chunks.description: Specfic email row for date range selectors.

chunks.name: fbEmailSectionHeader
chunks.description: Display pagetitle above each section in multi-page form emails.

chunks.name: fbStoreRow
chunks.description: Default template for displaying the submitted value of a form field through FormItRetriever.

chunks.name: fbStoreRow_xx
chunks.description: Example row, to be copied for each available ContentBlocks form field. The xx should be replaced with the ID of the CB field. Some fields require a different format (see below)

chunks.name: fbStoreRowTerms
chunks.description: Specific data row for Terms and Conditions checkbox.

chunks.name: fbStoreRowEmail
chunks.description: Specific data row for Email field.

chunks.name: fbStoreRowDateRange
chunks.description: Specfic data row for date range selectors.

templates.name: GlobalBackgrounds
templates.description: These backgrounds can be applied to page headers, CB layouts (under their Settings wheel) and possibly to other elements too.

templates.name: GlobalBackground
templates.description: Each background is a separate resource, in which you can add multiple layers with the Background Elements CB. Output of this template is for preview only. The CSS is generated separately.

templates.name: kbSection
templates.description: DEPRECATED. Knowledge base is implemented now as Notes (without Tickets integration).

templates.name: kbArticleMarkdown
templates.description: DEPRECATED. Knowledge base is implemented now as Notes (without Tickets integration).

snippets.name: Time
snippets.description: Return current timestamp.

snippets.name: getContextSetting
snippets.description: Retrieve a specific setting from a context of choice. Useful if you want to "borrow" a setting from another context, e.g. the correct site_url for assets only available in that context.

snippets.name: getElementDescription
snippets.description: Retrieve the description of an element. Used in the front-end library to prevent having to enter the same information twice. This paragraph is also loaded with getElementDescription!

snippets.name: firstChildID
snippets.description: The name says it all: retrieve the first child ID of a given ID.

snippets.name: returnFirstHit
snippets.description: Feed it a bunch of properties and it spits out the first one that's not empty. Property names are irrelevant. Sort order is all that matters.

snippets.name: getRawTVValue
snippets.description: Get the raw value of a TV. Usually when retrieving a TV value, it gets processed first before being returned. But sometimes you need the unprocessed value instead, e.g. when using @inherit.

snippets.name: getTmplvarID
snippets.description: Get the ID of a TV, in case you only know its name. Created for the front-end library, to help with listing included TVs.

snippets.name: cbHasFields
snippets.description: This is a copy of the original cbHasField snippet that ships with ContentBlocks. The only difference is that it takes in a comma separate list of IDs, instead of just 1.

snippets.name: cbRenderCodeField
snippets.description: For use in a CB Code field, together with a field setting to control how the :tag modifier is rendered. Useful for dealing with MODX tags inside a Code field, i.e. when writing documentation.

snippets.name: fbEmailGetJSON
snippets.description: DEPRECATED. Form data is now directly taken from CB properties field in fbValidateProcessJSON.

snippets.name: fbSimplxWidgeteer
snippets.description: DEPRECATED. Form report is now generated with fbFormReport.

snippets.name: fbFormReport
snippets.description: Generates a report from submitted field values. Primarily for emails, but you can also use this snippet to template other kinds of functionality (confirmation pages, multi page forms..).

snippets.name: fbValidateProcessJSON
snippets.description: Generates the correct strings for the FormIt &validate property.

snippets.name: fbInputRepeater
snippets.description: Parse the HTML output of repeating form fields and remember the submitted values of each field, in case the page is reloaded.

snippets.name: setBoxType
snippets.description: Output the necessary class names for Overview patterns, based on their template. It was created because the chunks where getting a bit swamped by output modifiers trying to do the same thing.

snippets.name: setBackground
snippets.description: Output the necessary class names for the applied Global Background.

snippets.name: modifiedIf
snippets.description: Customized If snippet with additional 'contains', 'containsnot' and 'isnumeric' operators, output to placeholder and option to prevent chunks from parsing before If statement is evaluated.

snippets.name: FibonacciSequence
snippets.description: Generate a sequence of Fibonacci numbers. In a Fibonacci sequence, every number after the first two is the sum of the two preceding ones.

snippets.name: jsonGetValue
snippets.description: Get the value of a specific key from a JSON string.

snippets.name: jsonGetObject
snippets.description: Search a JSON object for specific item and return the entire array. This is initially intended to turn CB repeater elements into CSS, without having to change the internal templating in CB.

snippets.name: jsonToHTML
snippets.description: Turn a JSON object into an HTML table. For documentation purposes.

snippets.name: jsonImportInputOptions
snippets.description: Generate input options from a JSON file. These options are written directly into their database table inside the Backyard package.

snippets.name: tvToJSON
snippets.description: Output the properties of given TV to a JSON object. The output could be used by jsonToHTML to generate an HTML table.

snippets.name: stripForJSON
snippets.description: Prepare the input for being used in JSON. This means escaping backslashes and double quotes.

snippets.name: stripAsAlias
snippets.description: Turn input into lowercase-hyphen-separated-alias-format and strip unwanted special characters. Useful for creating anchor links based on headings, for example.

snippets.name: stripWords
snippets.description: Opposed to the native MODX stripString modifier (which only allows you to strip a single value), stripWords lets you enter multiple (comma separated) values.

snippets.name: splitString
snippets.description: Divide string into multiple sections, based on a delimiter. Regular snippet call outputs sections to placeholders. If used as output modifier, specify the number of the part you want to get.

snippets.name: clipString
snippets.description: Trim the edges of a string. The given value represents the number of characters that will be clipped. If the value is negative, they will be clipped from the end of the string.

snippets.name: parseTags
snippets.description: Take in a comma separated string and turn each value into a separate tag. Sometimes you just need that :)

snippets.name: textToNumber
snippets.description: Turn a written number into an actual numeric value. In other words: turn "three" into "3". Can come in handy if you want to use the Semantic UI column width classes for other purposes.

snippets.name: round
snippets.description: Round a decimal value to a whole number or with a specified amount of decimals. Usage: [[+value:round=`2`]] returns the value with 2 decimals, [[+value:round]] returns a whole number.

snippets.name: filterLine
snippets.description: Search the input for lines containing a specific string. And then return those lines.

snippets.name: removeDuplicateLines
snippets.description: Scan input for duplicate lines and remove them from the output.

snippets.name: stripForJS
snippets.description: Prepare the input for being used in Javascript. This means escaping certain characters to make sure the surrounding HTML doesn't break.

snippets.name: generateStaticFile
snippets.description: Create a physical HTML file of a resource in the designated location. This is a utility snippet. Place it in the content somewhere and visit that page in the browser to generate the file.

snippets.name: generateCriticalCSS
snippets.description: Utility snippet to determine which CSS styles are used above the fold and write them to a custom CSS file. This needs NPM and the critical package to be installed.

snippets.name: sliderLoadAssets
snippets.description: Load CSS and JS dependencies for Swiper slider. It also initializes a Swiper instance for each slider, with it's own parameters. This means you can use multiple sliders on one page.

snippets.name: stepsLoadAssets
snippets.description: Load CSS styles for Steps component. This is not included in semantic.css by default, to keep its file size down.

snippets.name: statusGridLoadAssets
snippets.description: Load CSS and JS dependencies for status grid.

snippets.name: tabsGenerateNav
snippets.description: Generate the tab buttons based on data-heading attribute in the tabs themselves. It basically links every tab button to the correct tab content.

snippets.name: iconInputOptions
snippets.description: Generate input options with all Semantic UI icon classes.

snippets.name: responsiveImgSrcset
snippets.description: Generate a number of srcset properties, for use inside an img tag.

snippets.name: getImageDimensions
snippets.description: Retrieve width and height from physical image files. Auto detects SVGs.

snippets.name: getYoutubeThumb
snippets.description: Retrieve the largest existing thumbnail image available. You can choose between JPG and webP extension. Can be used as output modifier as well.

snippets.name: getResourceLevel
snippets.description: Show the level of a given resource based on the number of parent IDs. Useful for example if you only want to show a breadcrumb trail on pages that are two or three levels deep.

snippets.name: getChildCount
snippets.description: Return the amount of child pages a resource has. Now you can make one of those shiny little badges inside a menu button, telling the user upfront how much treasure is inside.

snippets.name: getCrosslinks
snippets.description: Return the IDs of resources that link to current resource through a given TV. Did that make sense? For example: you can show things like relevant tags or reviews in blog posts and vice versa.

snippets.name: renderResourceName
snippets.description: Takes an ID as input and returns the pagetitle. Mainly intended as snippet renderer for Collections, but can be used independently or as output modifier too.

snippets.name: renderContentType
snippets.description: Takes an ID as input and returns the content type. Mainly intended as snippet renderer for Collections, but can be used independently or as output modifier too.

snippets.name: resourceTVInputOptions
snippets.description: Generate input option values that can be used in TVs, for creating resource selectors.

snippets.name: resourceMediaPath
snippets.description: Standalone version of a snippet that comes with MIGX. Generates subfolders in media sources. Keeps your folder structure tidy when adding lots of images in lots of resources (e.g. galleries).

snippets.name: SeoTabIndexation
snippets.description: If SeoTab (StercSEO) is installed, this snippet displays the indexation setting for given resource.

snippets.name: migxSaveOption
snippets.description: After save hook for MIGXdb. Gets and sets the group (parent) ID inside a nested configuration. Also generates an alias if none is present and increments the sort order.

snippets.name: migxSaveOptionGroup
snippets.description: After save hook for MIGXdb. Updates existing keys in child options if you change this setting in Group. Also increments the sort order.

snippets.name: migxSaveRepurposeSrc
snippets.description: After save hook for MIGXdb. Sets current resource ID as re-purpose destination.

snippets.name: migxSaveRepurposeDest
snippets.description: After save hook for MIGXdb. Sets current resource ID as re-purpose source.

snippets.name: migxSaveRelated
snippets.description: After save hook for MIGXdb. Sets source and target IDs in opposite direction also, to establish a double cross-link. Yeah, watch your back with those!

snippets.name: migxResetNULL
snippets.description: After save hook for MIGXdb. Prevents database fields with default value of NULL from being set to 0 after a save action in MIGX.

snippets.name: renderInputOption
snippets.description: Fetch option name from the romanesco_options table (when used as output modifier). You can also get other available fields with a regular snippet call and tpl chunk.

snippets.name: setUserPlaceholders
snippets.description: Make any extended fields that are attached to a MODX user available as placeholder.

snippets.name: checkPermissions
snippets.description: Check if user is allowed to access the given (or current) context and redirect to unauthorized page if that's not the case.

snippets.name: renderUserName
snippets.description: Gets user by ID and returns the username. Mainly intended as snippet renderer for Collections, but can be used independently or as output modifier too.

plugins.name: ProcessMarkdown
plugins.description: Ensure correct Markdown rendering by setting the proper MIME type. Set the MIME type back to HTML when viewing the resource in the browser, to prevent the page from being downloaded as file.

plugins.name: ManipulateDOM
plugins.description: Manipulate DOM elements with HtmlPageDom. Yes, that's exactly what jQuery does... But now we can do it server side, before the page is rendered. Much faster and more reliable.

plugins.name: TableOfContents
plugins.description: Generate a menu with internal links to all headings in the content. The headers need to have an anchor, which can be automatically attached by switching on the auto_anchors TV.

plugins.name: setResourceGroup
plugins.description: Add resource to a specific group, based on certain conditions or variables.

plugins.name: fbLexiconMgr
plugins.description: Load FormBlocks lexicon in MODX manager.

plugins.name: fbLexiconWeb
plugins.description: Load FormBlocks lexicon in web context.

plugins.name: ManagerAugmentations
plugins.description: Small tweaks to the MODX backend, to enhance the Romanesco experience.

plugins.name: LexiconWeb
plugins.description: Load default lexicon in web context.

plugins.name: ClearCustomCache
plugins.description: Only clears cache partitions of navigation groups, to make sure save actions are immediately reflected on frontend. In the future, other partitions should be cleared on certain triggers too.

plugins.name: GenerateStaticCSS
plugins.description: Creates static CSS files for each context, with their own global backgrounds. If you want a context to have its own set of backgrounds, you need to add a child page under Global Backgrounds.

plugins.name: GenerateCriticalCSS
plugins.description: Determine which CSS styles are used above the fold and write them to a custom CSS file. This needs NPM and the critical package to be installed.

plugins.name: setResourceIDs
plugins.description: Looks for resource IDs of key Romanesco pages that were built by the Romanesco Backyard package. Updates system setting with corresponding ID if resource is found. Disabled by default.

plugins.name: UpdateStyling
plugins.description: Fires when theme settings are changed under Configuration. It updates Semantic UI theme.variables and triggers a new SUI build in the background. Requires NPM and EXEC function on the server.
